brief_summary.textblock:
Evaluation of the effectiveness of an individually educated exercise program for the lower
      back at home in employees over a period of 20 weeks.

      We hypothesize that regular exercise for the lower back results in greater improvements of
      low back strengths compared to controls.

clinical_study.condition: Healthy Volunteers With and Without Chronic Low Back Pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  men and women

          -  age between 18 and 67 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  beeing currently involved in an exercise program for the lower back

          -  known drug or alcohol abuse

          -  any disease that excludes the participation in an exercise program

          -  clinical relevant acute or chronic infections

          -  pregnant women

intervention.description: Educated exercise training for the trunk 3 times per week, each for 20 min. Recommendation of additional fitness courses as offered by the local healthy insurance company.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Home-based Exercise Program on Low Back Pain in Employees

primary_outcome.description: Assessed with the back-check 607 (Dr. WOLFF Sports and Prevention)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with the back-check 607 (Dr. WOLFF Sports and Prevention)
secondary_outcome.measure: Strenght at lateral flexion of the trunk (kg)

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with the Oswestry Low Back Pain Disability questionaire
secondary_outcome.measure: Oswestry Low Back Pain Disability Score

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with the visual analog scale
Assessed with the short form 36 questionaire
sick days at work will be assessed for the 20 weeks of the active intervention and the whole year the intervention is conducted

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
